definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
sentences.chinese: 他們歡喜，就約定給他銀子。

sentences.english: And he gives them a Denarius.
Each one of us will give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.
sentences.chinese: 我們就每人給你一千一百舍客勒銀子。

sentences.english: Altogether, the silver dishes weighed two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
sentences.chinese: 一切器皿的銀子，按聖所的平，共有二千四百。

sentences.english: If he is missing, it will be your life for his life, or you must pay a talent of silver.
sentences.chinese: 不然，你必交出一他連得銀子來。

sentences.english: I pour in the silver until I run out of silver.
Secrets are worth more than silver or sapphires, Varys claimed.
sentences.chinese: 瓦利斯聲稱祕密遠比銀子和藍寶石有價值。

sentences.english: So I bought her for fifteen shekels of silver and about a homer and a lethek of barley.
sentences.chinese: 我便用銀子十五舍客勒，大麥一賀梅珥半，買他歸我。

sentences.english: The priests who guarded the entrance put into the chest all the money that was brought to the temple of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 守門的祭司將奉到耶和華殿的一切銀子投在櫃裏。

sentences.english: There were about twenty taels of silver in all.
sentences.chinese: 將懷中帶着的二十幾兩碎銀子都掏了出來。

sentences.english: Pass silver, laughing seeing by Ya of the service leaves of figure.
sentences.chinese: 遞上銀子，笑着的看着衙役離開的背影。

sentences.english: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money.
sentences.chinese: 但那領一千的，去掘開地，把主人的銀子埋藏了。

sentences.english: They discovered a lot of silver down in South America, started bringing back to Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他們在南美洲發現了大量的銀子，並把它們帶回歐洲。

sentences.english: Her body was as white ivory, and her tail was of silver and pearl.
sentences.chinese: 她的身子白若象牙，而尾巴則好似珍珠與銀子的顏色。

sentences.english: A brave man did it and was immediately given 50 ounces of silver.
sentences.chinese: 當他把竹竿拿到北門時，商鞅立刻賞給他50兩銀子。

definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
silver currency/currency of the Qing dynasty based on the silver tael 兩|两
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
one block/one piece/one (unit of money)/together/in the same place/in company
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
